item.title: Artstation Learning - Career Building by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Many of my past and present students ask how they can improve their outward facing image and get ready to apply for their first job. Together with Artstation, I recently released a 3 part series on how to build your portfolio, persona, resume, and get ready for your first job in the industry.

Check it out here:
https://www.artstation.com/learning/series/lZ/career-building

Details:
In this three-part series, Clinton Crumpler leans on his in-depth experience, as an artist who hires artists, to help those looking for their next break get setup for success when it comes to career prep and building an attractive portfolio. Clinton covers Presenting Yourself, Applying and Interviewing, and Starting a New Job.
item.content:encoded:
Many of my past and present students ask how they can improve their outward facing image and get ready to apply for their first job. Together with Artstation, I recently released a 3 part series on how to build your portfolio, persona, resume, and get ready for your first job in the industry.

Check it out here:
https://www.artstation.com/learning/series/lZ/career-building

Details:
In this three-part series, Clinton Crumpler leans on his in-depth experience, as an artist who hires artists, to help those looking for their next break get setup for success when it comes to career prep and building an attractive portfolio. Clinton covers Presenting Yourself, Applying and Interviewing, and Starting a New Job.

item.title: Gears of War 5: Locust Test Tubes by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Gears of War 5: Locust Test Tubes

I was responsible for the creation of several test tubes and containers to be used throughout the testing lab
Completed in cooperation with the talented coalition environment team and co-development with multiple departments at the coalition such as VFX, Lighting, Animation and more!

Check out these other contributing artists that helped to make these!

https://www.artstation.com/joekoo
https://www.artstation.com/stefvelzeboer
https://www.artstation.com/virtualvagabond
https://www.artstation.com/ryandowlingsoka
https://www.artstation.com/malcolm341
https://www.artstation.com/kimoto
https://www.artstation.com/dcarman
https://www.artstation.com/goodbyekitty137
https://www.artstation.com/robertgoldney
https://www.artstation.com/mediumrare

and many more of the amazing folks at The Coalition!

item.title: Gears of War 5: Swarm and Shaders by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Gears of War 5: Swarm and Shaders

Some of my roles shown here for Gears 5:
- Modelling, texturing and refactoring the swarm shaders from Gears 4
- Shader and texture development of Kait's skin and eyes
- Prototype and shader development of Ice walls and structures
- Landscape shader development of sand open world
- Prototype of meshes formed from lighting strikes

Check out these other contributing artists:

https://www.artstation.com/joekoo
https://www.artstation.com/stefvelzeboer

item.title: Women's World Cup Paris, France 2019 - Fox Sports by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Women's World Cup France 2019 - Fox Sports - Paris UE4 Scene

Dekogon worked with Fox Sports and Drive Studio to recreate the iconic Paris, France based environment around the Eiffel Tower.
Dekogon was responsible for creating the environment models, textures, shaders, lighting, post processing, and performance checks to ensure the scene performed real-time for live broadcast television.

I worked as Creative Director on the project to ensure quality and overall look. I also worked on environment creation aspects such as shaders, asset creation, and texturing.

Huge shout out to all the Dekogon artists and the talented Taylor Brandenburger - https://www.artstation.com/theburger who was the associate Art Director on this project and was responsible for helping maintain artistic vision and creation of a vast amount of the environment work.

More info here:
https://www.unrealengine.com/en-US/spotlights/fox-sports-sets-new-record-with-fifa-women-s-world-cup-broadcast
item.content:encoded:
Women's World Cup France 2019 - Fox Sports - Paris UE4 Scene

Dekogon worked with Fox Sports and Drive Studio to recreate the iconic Paris, France based environment around the Eiffel Tower.
Dekogon was responsible for creating the environment models, textures, shaders, lighting, post processing, and performance checks to ensure the scene performed real-time for live broadcast television.

I worked as Creative Director on the project to ensure quality and overall look. I also worked on environment creation aspects such as shaders, asset creation, and texturing.

Huge shout out to all the Dekogon artists and the talented Taylor Brandenburger - https://www.artstation.com/theburger who was the associate Art Director on this project and was responsible for helping maintain artistic vision and creation of a vast amount of the environment work.

More info here:
https://www.unrealengine.com/en-US/spotlights/fox-sports-sets-new-record-with-fifa-women-s-world-cup-broadcast

item.title: Game Art Talk COOP: Taylor Brandenburger & Clinton Crumpler by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
A talk I did with Dekogon lead artist, Taylor Brandenburger and Dekogon artist, Christoph Redl on the keeping pace with freelancing, being a more responsible artist, and a general conversation on the gaming industry!

Video Information:
Dekogon Unreal Store: https://www.unrealengine.com/marketpl...
Clinton’s ArtStation: https://www.artstation.com/ccrumpler
Dekogon’s ArtStation: https://www.artstation.com/dekogon
Dekogon’s Website: http://www.dekogon.com/
Scavengers Website: https://scavengersgame.com/
Midwinter Entertainment: https://midwinter.net/
Game Art Talk Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyXqt5YUgBTA6SYJeWwZC2g
Christoph Redl Artstation: https://www.artstation.com/christophredl

item.title: Game Dev Discussion Ep : Clinton Crumpler by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Talk I recently did on the Game Dev Discussion Podcast
Thanks to Alex Beddows!
https://www.artstation.com/alexbeddows

Overview: On episode #7 of the GDD podcast I sit down with Dekogon owner Clinton Crumpler. We talk about his journey through multiple roles such as principle artists and being a mentor, as well as clearing some of the grey areas up surrounding Dekogon, how did it form, how do artists get involved and how does Clinton go about tackling the tricky topic of payment !

Related links:
Clinton's ArtStation - http://www.artstation.com/ccrumpler
Dekogons Artstation - http://www.artstation.com/dekogon
Spotify - http://open.spotify.com/show/7spDMpMZJ9dr3Ziu8bRwCA
Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/gamedevdiscussion
Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ajQV_-U2dI
iTunes - http://podcasts.apple.com/gb/podcast/game%E2%80%A6on/id1459400002
Twitter - http://twitter.com/BeddowsDesign

item.title: The Collective Podcast - Clinton Crumpler by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Listen Here: https://soundcloud.com/the-collective-podcast/ep-203-clinton-crumpler

Owner of Dekogon Studios Clinton Crumpler joins us this week to discuss the ideologies of his company, the benefits of working in Unreal Engine, his ability to turn ordinary objects into something special, and a bit about his experiences as an instructor.

GUEST LINKS:

Clinton’s Website: www.clintoncrumpler.com/
Clinton’s ArtStation: www.artstation.com/ccrumpler
Clinton’s Course: www.cgmasteracademy.com/instructors/4…nton-crumpler

Dekogon: www.dekogon.com/
Midwinter Entertainment: midwinter.net/

Gears of War: gearsofwar.com/en-us

item.title: Dekogon Kollab Project - Season 1 by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
The Dekogon Kollab Project consists of multiple artists contributing work to full sets of content releases.
Here are some of the cover marketing images of the content we released with Dekogon for the first half of this year!
Super impressed with how much wonderful high quality work the talented artists at Dekogon created in a few months!

As the Creative Director and Studio Head my responsibilities included:
- Setting Art Direction and Goals for the Team
- Lighting and Scene Setup
- Asset Quality Management and Feedback
- Material and Shader setup
- Creating Marketing Materials and Renders

Check out more here:
https://www.facebook.com/dekogon/
https://www.artstation.com/dekogon
www.dekogon.com

Content Available for purchase here:
Gumroad - https://gumroad.com/dekogonstudios
Cubebrush - http://cbr.sh/2mbnzt
Unreal Marketplace - https://www.unrealengine.com/marketplace/profile/Dekogon%20Studios

item.title: First Post - Updates by Clinton Crumpler
item.content:encoded:
Hey all!
So this will be the first of a monthly to quarterly chain of blogs to talk about updates, new works, and general tinkering I have been up to.
First off, I recently joined the team at Midwinter Entertainment as a Principal Environment Artist. 

I will be working with them through my personal company Dekogon Studios.  This comes after my recent departure from The Coalition, as a Senior Look Development Artist. It was a great experience to get to work on the Gears of War franchise alongside the talented Microsoft team, but I took this step with Midwinter to work on a new IP and try something experimental and challenging with a smaller scale team. I always enjoy the multiple hats and roles you take on with a smaller team and look forward to the interesting year ahead on the new project. Keep an eye out for more details soon and what we are working on at Midwinter!

Speaking of Dekogon - Awesome work has been coming out of the talented artist at Dekogon in the past few months! So many passionate artists have been sharing their work on Artstation. For those who have not heard of Dekogon yet, it is an artist collective that consists of my work as well as the work of many other artists around the globe in a collaborative effort. We did a write up talking about the Kollab portion of Dekogon studios here on 80 lvl. Many of the recent assets can be purchased on our website for personal or professional project use!
A few shots can be found below but check here to see the whole collection.
Check out Dekogon's own Artstation here!
More content from Dekogon coming soon as well...

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/zrz5w

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/xXEoE

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/KDlkR

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/wodmV

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/KZBwR

https://www.artstation.com/artwork/XLw8a

I also finished up a few freelance projects recently. One was a collaborative project Kurt Kupser and I completed for a VR City Scene. This was done for a client through Dekogon. It was designed to be a technical demo running in unreal engine using VR with all optimizations achieved to make it run at 90fps. I worked primarily on look dev, modeling, level design, and layout and Kurt tackled some of the models and the majority of our textures in the scene. This project is still under wraps, but as more emerges I will be posting more info about it!
 
You can find more images here!
Also check out Kurt Kupser's work here.


Lastly I am teaching at CGMA a course on modularity for environment art in games. Classes just started for this semester but there will be another class coming soon for registration. Check out my class, Kurt Kupser's class and many other talented instructors here!

Alright! That's all for now. Next time I talk about some art or some tech and less about me :P.

item.title: AIE Interview: Breaking into the Industry by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Recent talk I did with Jake Higgs and the students at AIE on breaking into the gaming industry!
80 level has the full transcript as well!
https://80.lv/articles/breaking-into-the-industry/

Artist Information:
Clinton Crumpler
Senior Environment Artists on Gears of War @ The Coalition
www.clintoncrumpler.com

AIE Information:
AIE courses are practical, career-focused and delivered by industry experienced teachers in a seriously fun and creatively-demanding studio environment.

Website Link: www.aie.edu.au
Twitter: https://twitter.com/aieedu
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AIEedu/

Campus locations Australia: Adelaide, Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney
Campus locations United States: Lafayette and Seattle
Worldwide : Online

item.title: Gears of War 4: DLC Content by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
I had the opportunity after finishing Gears 4 to work on a number of DLC multiplayer maps. Some of maps I worked on included: The Slab, Diner, Blood Drive, Clocktower, Checkout, and Drydocks to name a few. Here are a collection of assets that I worked on for those levels.

I also added some of the videos that were publicly released by The Coalition showing a flythrough of the DLC maps.
item.content:encoded:
I had the opportunity after finishing Gears 4 to work on a number of DLC multiplayer maps. Some of maps I worked on included: The Slab, Diner, Blood Drive, Clocktower, Checkout, and Drydocks to name a few. Here are a collection of assets that I worked on for those levels.

I also added some of the videos that were publicly released by The Coalition showing a flythrough of the DLC maps.

item.title: Battlecry by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Some screens from the game Battlecry from Battlecry Studio.
Unfortunately this title's creation has since been postponed.

There are not many public shots released but here are a few of one's from the map I worked on. Most of this was still WIP but it is always nice to wonder what could have been.

My primary responsibilities where PBR workflow development for the team in the creation of stylized environments and texture creation.
I also worked on mesh creation and world building.

Unfortunately this title's creation has since been postponed.

There are not many public shots released but here are a few of one's from the map I worked on. Most of this was still WIP but it is always nice to wonder what could have been.

My primary responsibilities where PBR workflow development for the team in the creation of stylized environments and texture creation.
I also worked on mesh creation and world building.

item.title: 3DArtist Magazine - Light a Cinematic Scene in Unreal by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
3D Artist - Issue 104 - Light a Cinematic Scene in Unreal

I recently had the honor to do an article for 3DArtist Magazine to talk about cinematic lighting and scene layout. I really enjoyed the opportunity to give some insight into my process and share some of the breakdowns for the laundromat scene.

Special thanks the Brian Bunch and Amanda Compton for checking my final edits!

3D Artist - Issue 104 - Light a Cinematic Scene in Unreal

Special thanks the Brian Bunch and Amanda Compton for checking my final edits!

item.title: Gears of War 4: Marcus and Reyna Swarm Cinematics by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Cinematics of the Swarm from Gears of War 4.

Warning: Spoilers!!

Worked with Cinematics, Meshing, Lighting, and other departments to created the cinematic swarm aspects for the Marcus pod and Reyna ending scene.

The shots shown here illustrate the use, placement, and interactions of the swarm environmental aspects in the cinematics.

My work consisted of creating the environmental swarm materials, textures, and meshes for both scenes (tendrils, pods, goo, etc.)

Many thanks to all the hard work each department put in to making each of these cinematics.
Special shout out to Sasha Dunfee and Krzysztof Teper for awesome work on these scenes!
item.content:encoded:
Cinematics of the Swarm from Gears of War 4.

Warning: Spoilers!!

Worked with Cinematics, Meshing, Lighting, and other departments to created the cinematic swarm aspects for the Marcus pod and Reyna ending scene.

The shots shown here illustrate the use, placement, and interactions of the swarm environmental aspects in the cinematics.

My work consisted of creating the environmental swarm materials, textures, and meshes for both scenes (tendrils, pods, goo, etc.)

Many thanks to all the hard work each department put in to making each of these cinematics.
Special shout out to Sasha Dunfee and Krzysztof Teper for awesome work on these scenes!

item.title: Gears of War 4: Swarm Environments by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Environment screens of the Swarm from Gears of War 4.

In working with tech, meshing, lighting, and various other departments the environmental design of the swarm was created to be integrated in many of the structures and buildings throughout the game.

The shots shown here illustrate the use, placement, and interactions of the swarm environmental aspects throughout the game.

Many thanks to all the hard work each department put in to making each of these environments and scenes.

item.title: Gears of War 4: Swarm Assets by Clinton Crumpler
item.description:
Individual Swarm Assets, Props, Textures, etc from Gears of War 4.

I created and worked on many of the swarm environmental assets for Gears of War 4.
My primary roles were creation of the materials, meshes, and textures for the pods, tendrils, skins, decals, goo, and some effects.

In working with tech, meshing, lighting, and various other departments the environmental design of the swarm was created to be integrated in many of the structures and buildings thought out the game.

Special thanks to Ryan DowlingSoka and Kurt Diegert for continuous tech support on swarm.
item.content:encoded:
Individual Swarm Assets, Props, Textures, etc from Gears of War 4.

I created and worked on many of the swarm environmental assets for Gears of War 4.
My primary roles were creation of the materials, meshes, and textures for the pods, tendrils, skins, decals, goo, and some effects.

In working with tech, meshing, lighting, and various other departments the environmental design of the swarm was created to be integrated in many of the structures and buildings thought out the game.

Special thanks to Ryan DowlingSoka and Kurt Diegert for continuous tech support on swarm.
